title: Neon Noir Detective Office Adventure #98
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Private Detective Office
rooms.description: A dimly lit office bathed in neon pink and blue light from the window signs outside. Rain streaks down the glass. A cluttered desk sits in the center, surrounded by filing cabinets and a worn leather couch. The air smells of stale coffee and cigarette smoke. A flickering neon sign outside casts dancing shadows on the walls.

items.name: detective's desk
items.description: A heavy wooden desk covered in case files, coffee rings, and a vintage rotary phone. Three drawers are built into the front.

items.name: case file summary
items.description: A typed document summarizing the current investigation
items.text: CASE #1947 - The Neon Phantom. Client: Victoria Steele. Missing person case opened in 1947. Subject last seen near the Chrome District. Lead detective: Jack Marlowe. Evidence stored in secure room. Access restricted.

items.name: brass evidence key
items.description: A worn brass key with an evidence tag attached

items.name: metal filing cabinet
items.description: A tall gray cabinet with multiple drawers, most locked or jammed

items.name: private investigator license
items.description: A laminated license card
items.text: Licensed Private Investigator: Jack Marlowe. License #1947. Specialization: Missing Persons. Office Location: Chrome District, Floor 23.

items.name: worn leather couch
items.description: A sagging couch with cracked leather and cigarette burns

items.name: old newspaper
items.description: A yellowed newspaper from 1947
items.text: CHROME DISTRICT GAZETTE - 1947: Victoria Steele reported missing. Last seen at the Neon Lounge. Police have no leads. Family offers reward. Anyone with information should contact the authorities or private investigators in the Chrome District.

items.name: empty whiskey bottle
items.description: An empty bottle of cheap whiskey on the desk

items.name: evidence room door
items.description: A reinforced door with a keyhole and a small frosted glass window. A sign reads 'Evidence Storage'.

rooms.name: Evidence Storage Room
rooms.description: A cramped room lined with metal shelves holding evidence boxes, tagged items, and case files. A single bare bulb swings from the ceiling, casting harsh shadows. The walls are covered with photos, maps, and red string connecting various clues. A large vault door dominates the far wall, its surface gleaming under the light.

items.name: evidence box labeled A
items.description: A cardboard box containing items from various cases

items.name: witness testimony document
items.description: A typed statement from a witness
items.text: WITNESS STATEMENT: I saw Victoria Steele at the Neon Lounge on the night she disappeared. She was meeting someone, but I couldn't see who. She mentioned something about going to the Chrome District to meet her contact. Signed: Anonymous Witness, 1947.

items.name: evidence box labeled B
items.description: A sealed box with a broken lock

items.name: black and white photograph
items.description: A photo of a woman standing outside a building
items.text: Photo shows Victoria Steele outside the Neon Lounge. On the back is written: 'Victoria Steele - Last known photo. Case #1947. Detective Jack Marlowe investigating.'

items.name: city map with markings
items.description: A large map of the city with red circles and notes
items.text: Map shows the Chrome District highlighted. Notes indicate: 'Victoria last seen here. Neon Lounge - starting point. Vault contains final evidence. Security protocol requires case knowledge.'

items.name: stack of case files
items.description: A pile of manila folders with various case numbers

items.name: final case report
items.description: A confidential report marked 'Case Closed'
items.text: FINAL REPORT - Case #1947: Victoria Steele found safe. She had gone into hiding voluntarily. Case closed by Detective Jack Marlowe. Evidence secured in vault. Access requires verification: detective name, subject name, and last known location.

items.name: secure vault door
items.description: A massive steel vault door with a digital keypad. Three security questions are displayed on a screen.

password_questions.question: Who is the lead detective on this case?
password_questions.hint: Check the case summary and detective license

password_questions.question: What is the name of the missing person?
password_questions.hint: The case files and newspaper mention her name

password_questions.question: Where was the subject last seen?

rooms.name: Secure Evidence Vault
rooms.description: You have accessed the secure vault! The room is pristine and climate controlled, filled with shelves of carefully preserved evidence from solved cases. In the center, on a pedestal under glass, sits the final piece of evidence from Case #1947: a handwritten letter from Victoria Steele explaining everything. A green exit light glows above a door marked 'Emergency Exit to Street Level'.

items.name: display case
items.description: A glass case containing the final evidence

items.name: letter from Victoria Steele
items.description: A handwritten letter sealed in protective plastic
items.text: Dear Detective Marlowe, Thank you for your discretion. I needed to disappear for my own safety, but I am well. The case can be closed. I trust you will keep my location confidential. The truth is now in your hands. - Victoria Steele

items.name: organized evidence shelves
items.description: Rows of neatly labeled evidence from decades of solved cases

rooms.win_message: Case closed! You have successfully navigated the detective office, accessed the evidence room, and unlocked the secure vault. The mystery of Victoria Steele is solved, and you have proven yourself a worthy detective. The neon lights of the city await as you exit into the rain-soaked streets. You win!
